column2: Pure body leads to pure heart which leads to pure spirit.
Convert to the faith of my ancestral forefathers!
Help in fighting the local bandits

You find yourself touring an impoverished province, when word reaches you of a band of ruffians terrorizing local farmers. You remember Zarathustra preaching not only to live righteously but to actively fight evil whenever one can.
Send a squad of your guards
Let the locals handle it themselves

A petition came today from your Muslim vassals to help them rebuild their mosque destroyed in a recent fire. Will you choose the path of tolerance chosen by many of the famous Zoroastrian Shahs of old, or will you ignore those not following the teachings of Zarathustra?
Today I partake in Sedreh Pushi, an ancient initiation ritual. Form this day on I will be a proud member of the Zoroastrian flock

Today your child partakes in a Sedreh Pushi, an initiation ceremony. [From.GetSheHe] will don a shirt (sudreh), girdle (kusti) and a covering for the head and begin a new life as a member of the Zoroastrian flock. You can use this opportunity to teach [From.GetHerHim] something about your faith.
Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Khshatr, divine power
Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Vohu Manah, holy spirit
Made a large sacrifice to Mithra
Made a large sacrifice to Parendi
Made a large sacrifice to Chisti
Make a large sacrifice to Mithra
Make a large sacrifice to Parendi
Make a large sacrifice to Chisti
Mithra is a divinity associated with war.
Parendi is a divinity associated with riches.
Chisti is a divinity associated with wisdom.
Publicly proclaim him as the Wicked one - the man who yielded to the temptation of Druj.
Publicly proclaim him as the Righteous one - the man who follows the path of Asha.
Carrier of a ceremonial sword in the court
The reader of stars, helps to make tough decision
The one that leads the royal hunts
Rebuild the religous hierarchy of old by appointing a head to Zoroastrian church - Zorothustraema
[From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] have gotten married. We can collect a Royal Aid Duty to pay for the ceremonies.

You have decided to rebuild the capital of the ancient Persian empire. You comission quarries to deliver large amounts of marble and gather masons from around the realm to build it. How ambitious should this project be?
Make it even greater than it was!
Now that you consolidated your power over the heartland of the Persian empire, you can rebuild the ancient Achaemenid capital.

The new city is almost complete. What do you want to work on as a great project to complete the city? You can rebuild the ancient library to further our scholars' work, you can reconstruct the irrigation system to allow you to support more troops, or you can rebuild the Gate of all nations to dazzle the emmisaries from the poeples you subjugated.
Rebuild the Gate of all nations.
Rebuilding of the city is in progress, construct buildings in your capital.

As [Root.GetSheHe] is your prisoner, you may give the order to permanently blind [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and then setting [Root.GetHerHim] free. This is a common Persian way of dealing with political rivals without outright killing them, as a blind [Root.GetManWoman] is of little threat to the throne
It is nearly time for the Nowruz celebration, invitations to come have been sent to your subjects
Your liege has sent you an invitation for the Nowruz celebration, will you be attending?
One of your invited guests has declined your invitation
Now that the guests have arrived, the Nowruz celebration can begin.
The celebration is over now that the New Year has came and past.
The celebration is over now that the New Year has came and past.
To celebrate the New Year, the practice of Chaharshanbe Suri reenacts the process of the changing alignment of the planetsm through jumping through hoops of fire.
Now that Ctesiphon is rebuilt, we can restore the glorious canal to restore the breadbasket of the empire
Due to the low religious authority of the Sunni faith, people have embraced another religion in this province
Yazdanism is spreading like wildfire among our Kurdish subjects

Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a genderless god of of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god Ahura Mazda and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism,where Ahura Mazda is the Supreme Being, Zurvanism was further divided,by its three schools of thought, Aesthetic, Fatalistic and Materialistic.
This character has forgone consuming meat
This character is a member of the Manichean elect, making them paragons of virtue
This character has proved their devotion to an extreme by having themselves castrated
Become a vegetarian to show your devotion to the almighty.
As a devoted Manichee, end your desire to the physical flesh as a sign of devotion
With the Archegos landed in Samarqand and a proper Maincaen Shah in Sogdia, a holy order has been created to defend these lands
Now that Samarqand has been captured by our divine forces, we can properly seat the Archegos in Samarqand
Now that the Archegos has been properly landed in Samarqand, we should establish a order of holy warriors to defend the land

column3: now that we have retaken our empire, we can bring back the Sassanian Era Provincial Names

column2: Fund Shanameh, the epic poem of the old Zoroastrian Dynasties, the national epic of the Iranian peoples.
It is nearly time for Nowruz, or the Persian New Year, we should start preparing in advance and send invitations to the subjects
Now that we hold all of the Persian Empire, we can now rebuild the grand capital of the Sassanid Empire
Fund an addition to the Shahnameh to record the tales of your predescesor

Yazdanism covers large number of religious beliefs, held by people mainly ethnic Kurds, living in Zagros mountains. These religions are syncretic and include elements from old Mesopotamian religions, Zoroastrianism, Christianity and so on Main aspects, are belief on single God and/or seven angels/benevolent beings such as Melek Taus ("Peacock Angel"), who protect mankind from malign forces. While these religions are distinct and unique, in game-terms Yazdanism is considered a Zoroastrian heresy.
